excerpt: Dating to the 7th century, this towering Buddhist pagoda was built to house sacred scriptures.
detail_description: The Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, also known as Big Wild Goose Pagoda, is a renowned attraction in Xi'an, China. Dating back to the 7th century during the Tang Dynasty, this brick pagoda was initially constructed with five stories to house Buddhist scriptures and figurines brought from India. Renovated during the Ming Dynasty, it now stands at a height of 64 meters and serves as a well-preserved religious site for Buddhists.
name: Giant Wild Goose Pagoda
address: 1 Cien Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Large history museum displaying fossils, murals, pottery & metal objects in a Tang-style building.
detail_description: Shaanxi History Museum, located near the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, is a large museum housed in a traditional Tang-style building. It boasts over 370,000 cultural relics dating back over 1 million years to the late Qing dynasty. The museum holds various exhibitions and also features Chinese and foreign classic paintings, calligraphy works, children's paintings, photography, sculpture works, film and television media art.
name: Shaanxi History Museum
address: 91 Xiaozhai E Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: This long, historic city wall with scenic views is a popular place for walking & bicycling.
detail_description: Xian's Ancient City Wall is a well-preserved historic site that offers scenic views and is popular for walking and bicycling. The city of Xian, though not one of China's largest, is a top tourist destination due to its rich historical monuments and ancient sites such as the Terracotta Warriors, Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, and the Ancient City Wall. Visitors can also explore the Shaanxi History Museum to delve into Chinese history.
name: Ancient City Wall
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Beilin, 陕西

excerpt: Opulent mosque built in 742 & featuring colorful architecture & placid gardens.
detail_description: The Great Mosque of Xi'an is a stunning architectural marvel built in 742, boasting vibrant and colorful designs along with serene gardens. The mosque stands as a symbol of the harmonious coexistence between Muslim and Han people in Xian. Surrounding the mosque, visitors can explore streets lined with various crafts and traditional Shaanxi handicrafts. Nearby, the Muslim Quarter offers an array of delectable Muslim cuisine, including roasted beef, fish, and pancakes at reasonable prices.
name: Great Mosque of Xi'an
address: 7W7Q+7JF, Huajue Ln, Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710001

detail_description: The Drum Tower in Xi'an, China is a significant landmark that serves as the gateway to the Muslim Quarter. It is located in the Northwest quadrant of the ancient walled city and offers a glimpse into the area's rich history dating back to the 7th Century AD. The nearby Bell Tower acts as a central landmark from which prosperous commercial streets extend in all directions.
name: Drum Tower
address: 6WQR+2QV, Jianfusi Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Iconic bell tower built in 1384 during the Ming dynasty with historic displays & city vistas.
detail_description: The Bell Tower of Xi'an, built in 1384 during the Ming dynasty, is a historic landmark that has stood for over 600 years. Originally used to announce the time, it now serves as a museum showcasing cultural relics and traditional artworks. Visitors can enjoy daytime performances and admire stunning scenery at night. Situated at the geographical center of ancient Xian, this iconic wooden tower stands 36m tall on a nearly 9m high brick base.
name: Bell Tower of Xi'an
address: 7W5W+QRJ, Bei Lin Qu, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710007

detail_description: The Museum of Qin Terracotta Warriors and Horses West Gate is a significant part of the Emperor Qinshihuangs Mausoleum Site Museum, which includes the Qin Shihuang Mausoleum Relics Park and Lishan Garden. This museum showcases the world-renowned Terracotta Army, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of China's national AAAAA level tourist attractions. The burial pit covers an extensive area of 2.
name: Museum of Qin Terracotta Warriors and Horses West Gate
address: 97MG+G67, Wangjian Rd, Lintong District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710611

detail_description: The Bell Tower Commercial Area is the city's largest shopping district, offering a variety of big department stores and supermarkets. Nearby, visitors can explore the famous Muslim Street for souvenirs, food, and handicrafts. The area also features upscale malls like Kai Yuan Shopping Mall and Century Ginwa Shopping Mall. Additionally, the Bell Tower serves as an entrance to the Big Wild Goose Pagoda tourist area where visitors can admire its historical construction that is well preserved and maintained.
name: Bell Tower
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Yanta District, Cien Rd, 慈恩路大慈恩寺内, 邮政编码: 710063

excerpt: Museum of objects from the Banpo archaeological dig, which uncovered a 6,000-year-old civilization.
detail_description: Banpo Museum is a fascinating destination that showcases objects from the Banpo archaeological site, revealing a 6,000-year-old civilization. Situated on the relics of Neolithic Yangshao culture, it offers an enriching experience for history enthusiasts. Visitors can easily access this museum by driving eastward for Lintong or taking City Bus U5 (306) from the railway station's east square.
name: Banpo
address: 155 Banpo Rd, Baqiao District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710024

detail_description: Huaqing Palace, also referred to as Huaqing Hot Springs, is a renowned historical site that has served as an imperial palace for over 3000 years. Situated at the foot of Mount Li, it was initially built by Emperor Zhouyouwang of the Western Zhou Dynasty and later used by emperors from various dynasties including Qin, Han, Sui, and Tang for winter retreats.
name: Huaqing Palace
address: Lin Tong Qu, Xi An Shi, China, 710699

detail_description: The Tang Dynasty, established in 1988, is a cultural treasure of Xi'an that attracts both locals and visitors. It stands out as the first establishment to showcase dance and music performances in the ancient Tang Dynasty style. This venue offers a unique experience with nightly dinner theater where guests can enjoy both food and performances, reminiscent of imperial palace luxury.
name: Tang Dynasty
address: 75 Chang'an N Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Landmark pagoda dating to 8th century offering scenic views from the top & an adjacent park.
detail_description: Small Wild Goose Pagoda is a must-see landmark in Xi'an, China. Dating back to the 8th century, it offers stunning views from the top and is surrounded by an adjacent park. The pagoda is part of the historical Jianfu Temple complex, which has been rebuilt during the Ming and Qing dynasties.
name: Small Wild Goose Pagoda
address: 72 Youyi W Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Xi’an is a large city and capital of Shaanxi Province in central China. Once known as Chang’an (Eternal Peace), it marks the Silk Road’s eastern end and was home to the Zhou, Qin, Han and Tang dynasties' ruling houses. At archaeological sites in Xi’an’s surrounding plains are the famed Bingmayong (Terra Cotta Army), thousands of life-size, hand-molded figures buried with China’s first emperor, Qin Shi Huang.
detail_description: Xi'an, the vibrant capital of Shaanxi Province in central China, is a city steeped in over 3,000 years of history. Once known as Chang’an or 'Eternal Peace,' it served as a pivotal hub on the Silk Road and was home to several influential dynasties including the Zhou, Qin, Han, and Tang. Today, amidst its modern architecture and bustling streets lies an array of historical treasures.
name: Xi'An
address: Shaanxi, China

detail_description: Xi'an City Wall Wen Chang Gate is a popular area for tourists, especially families, due to its proximity to major attractions like the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda and Shaanxi History Museum. It offers convenient transportation, parks, art galleries, shopping centers, and child-friendly entertainment options. The massive fortification was built during the Ming Dynasty and is best explored by cycling or walking along its 14-kilometer length for stunning views of Xi'an.
name: Xi'an City Wall Wen Chang Gate
address: 7X23+R48, Shuncheng Ln, 钟楼商圈 Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710001

detail_description: The Muslim Street Tourist Service Station is a bustling area located just 100 meters from the Bell Tower, known for its historical significance as a stop along the Silk Road. Visitors can explore shops offering a variety of cultural specialties, including souvenirs, food, and handicrafts. The Beiyuanmen Night Market within the Muslim Quarter is a popular spot to sample local cuisine and shop for affordable goods.
name: Muslim Street Tourist Service Station
address: 167 Xiyangshi, 钟楼商圈 Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710007

detail_description: Cuihua Mountain is a natural wonder in Xian, China, offering a serene escape from the city's fast pace. In addition to famous landmarks like the Bell and Drum Towers and the ancient city wall, Xian boasts this awe-inspiring mountain. Visitors can easily navigate the city using public transportation such as the metro, bus, train, and taxi. Special tourist bus lines and sightseeing hop-on-hop-off buses make exploring convenient.
name: Cuihua Mountain
address: Chang'An, Xi'An, China, 710105

detail_description: Daming Palace, located in Xincheng District, is a vast national heritage park that was once the magnificent Imperial Palace of the Tang Dynasty. It is three times larger than Versailles, four-and-a-half times bigger than the Forbidden City, and 15 times the size of Buckingham Palace. The palace ruins were excavated in the 1950s and offer a glimpse into the grandeur of ancient Chinese architecture. Visitors can explore this historical site and enjoy its serene surroundings.
name: Daming Palace
address: 7XM5+4P8, Beibei Qu, Chongqing Shi, China, 710015

detail_description: Xianyang Museum, located about nineteen miles northwest of Xi'an, was once the capital of the Qin Dynasty. The museum is housed in a building that was formerly a Confucian Temple and features nine exhibition halls showcasing 130,000 historical artifacts, including Buddhist statues, stone carvings, imperial tombs, and ruins dating back over 2,000 years.
name: Xianyang Museum
address: CV46+QPW, Weicheng District, Xianyang, Xianyang, Shaanxi, China, 712039

excerpt: Attraction renowned for lifelike sculptures of terra-cotta warriors built around the 3rd century BC.
detail_description: Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum is home to the famous terra-cotta warriors, crafted around the 3rd century BC. The museum, opened in 1979, encloses three major pits where visitors can see lifelike sculptures of warriors and horses. The soldiers exhibit remarkable individuality with their various features and attire.
name: Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum
address: Lintong District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710612

detail_description: The Shaanxi Tri-coloured Glazed Pottery of the Tang Dynasty Art Museum, also known as TangBo Art Museum, is a small yet captivating museum that offers a journey through the history of ancient Chinese art. Visitors can explore representative local folk arts and ancient Chinese paintings while also having the opportunity to participate in a cultural lesson on calligraphy. The museum provides an immersive experience that lasts about 1.
name: Shaanxi Tri-coloured Glazed Pottery of the Tang Dynasty Art Museum
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Beilin, 二环南路东段入口, 友谊东路449号影视大厦, 邮政编码: 710064

excerpt: 2nd-century BC mausoleum for a Han dynasty emperor, with a museum exhibiting artifacts & models.
detail_description: Han Yang Ling is a 2nd-century BC mausoleum located in the capital of the Qin Dynasty. The city is scattered with several grand burial complexes, including Han Yang Ling Mausoleum, Qianling Mausoleum, and Zhaoling Mausoleum. The underground museum at Han Yang Ling houses the tomb of Emperor Jing Liu Qi and features artifacts and models from that era.
name: Han Yang Ling
address: CWVG+M4F, Weicheng District, Xianyang, Xianyang, Shaanxi, China, 712038

excerpt: Theme park with replicas of Tang Dynasty buildings, cultural performances & an evening light show.
detail_description: Tang Paradise, completed in 2005, is the largest cultural theme park in Northwest China. It is a model imperial garden showcasing the charm and grandeur of the Tang Dynasty. The 165-acre site features replicas of Tang Dynasty buildings and twelve scenic regions including Ziyun Tower Block, Elegant Lady Area, Imperial Banquet Hall, and more. Located near the Big Wild Goose Pagoda, it offers magnificent imitations of Tang architecture and beautiful scenery illuminated at night.
name: Tang Paradise
address: 99 Furong W Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710061

detail_description: Xi'an Muslim Dasi Residential Quarter, also known as Huimin Street or the Muslim Quarter, is located behind the Drum Tower and around the Great Mosque. This bustling area is a popular spot for souvenir shopping, with vendors initially quoting high prices. The quarter offers a vibrant atmosphere with colorful street food catering to various budgets and tastes. As you navigate through the lively streets, you'll encounter historical insights about the arrival of Muslims in Xi'an and their connection to the Silk Road.
name: Xi'an Muslim Dasi Residential Quarter
address: 90 Beiguangji St, 钟楼商圈 Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710008

excerpt: Expansive airport offering numerous flights & a variety of shops & restaurants, plus other services.
detail_description: Xi'an Xianyang International Airport is a large and bustling airport with a wide range of flights to both domestic and international destinations. It offers various shops, restaurants, and services for travelers. The airport can be easily accessed through multiple metro lines, buses, and taxis. The arrival area is spacious and clean with helpful staff providing shuttle bus and taxi services. Travelers can also find tourist information assistance in the adjacent building.
name: Xi'an Xianyang International Airport
address: CQP4+RWW, Wei Cheng Qu, Xianyang, Shaanxi, China

detail_description: Qujiang Sites Park of Mausoleum of the Second Emperor of Qin is a part of the World Heritage List and offers a glimpse into ancient Chinese history. The park features the City Wall of the Ming Dynasty, which is the largest and most well-preserved castle from that era. Visitors can explore the 3,000-year-old Banpo Village Remains from the Neolithic Age and marvel at the Forest of Stone Steles, housing 3,000 stone steles from different periods.
name: Qujiang Sites Park of Mausoleum of the Second Emperor of Qin
address: 5XVM+4XW, Qujiangchi S Rd, 曲江商圈 Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710061

detail_description: Kaiyuan Shopping Mall, situated at the southeastern corner of the Bell Tower in Xi'an, is a prominent department store offering an extensive range of over 130,000 products. It boasts a high-quality shopping environment and exceptional service for all visitors. As one of the largest shopping centers in Xi'an, it provides reasonable prices and caters to diverse shopping needs. Additionally, its central location makes it easily accessible for locals and tourists alike.
name: Kaiyuan Shopping Mall
address: 6 Jiefang Mkt, 钟楼商圈 Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710004

detail_description: Century Ginwa is a prestigious shopping center situated between the historic Bell Tower and Drum Tower in Xi'an. Since its establishment in 1998, it has become a hub for over sixty renowned global brands such as Bally, Burberry, Dior, Givenchy, Lancome, and Estee Lauder. The mall caters to discerning customers seeking high-quality products.
name: Century Ginwa
address: Wei Yang Qu, Xi An Shi, China, 710018

detail_description: In the heart of Xi'an, you'll find the Bell Tower and Drum Tower, two distinct structures that are worth exploring. The Bell Tower stands tall at 36 meters and is situated at the city's central intersection. Meanwhile, the Drum Tower is located near the vibrant Muslim Quarter known for its Halal foods. Both towers offer stunning views, especially at night. To make the most of your visit, consider purchasing a joint ticket to access both attractions.
name: Bell Tower and Drum Tower
address: 7W6V+8C4, Beiyuanmen, 北院门小吃一条街 Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710008

detail_description: Xingqinggong Park in Xian is a beautiful and well-maintained park that offers various activities for visitors. You can join in aerobics, singing, and dancing or take a leisurely walk around the lake. The park also features a small amusement park that is perfect for families with kids. During spring and summer, the park blooms with colorful flowers, making it an ideal time to visit.
name: Xingqinggong Park
address: 55 Xianning W Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710048

detail_description: Guangren Temple Ticket Office, also known as 23 Eight Immortals Temple or Wanshou Baxian Gong, is located at 12 Beihuo Alley in the Beilin District. It is situated approximately 1 km southwest of Kangfu Lu Metro Station on Line 1. The temple stands within the serene grounds of Jianfu Temple and was affected by an earthquake in the mid-16th century, causing damage to its top.
name: Guangren Temple Ticket Office
address: 7WFG+H6P, Lianmeng Ln, Lianhu District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710082

detail_description: Antique Market, also known as the Ancient Cultural Street of Shuyuanmen, is a must-visit destination for souvenir shopping. Here you can find unique items such as Tang tri-colored glazed pottery, replicas of Terracotta warriors, and traditional folk handicrafts like paper-cut and shadow puppets. In addition to these cultural treasures, the market also offers modern shopping options including large shopping centers and department stores.
name: Antique Market
address: China, CN 陕西省 西安市 碑林区 长乐坊 163 163号, 邮政编码: 710033

detail_description: Situated near the Terracotta Army Museum in Xian, Huaqing Hot Spring Bathhouse is a renowned attraction with warm springs and exquisite Chinese classical architecture. It holds a romantic history involving Emperor Xuanzong and his concubine Yang Yuhuan. The site features the Song of Everlasting Sorrow Show against the backdrop of Lishan Mountain, showcasing ponds, pavilions, corridors, and palaces.
name: Huaqing Hot Spring Bathhouse
address: 5WH6+W2G, Zhangdu Rd, 长安区西部大学城商圈 Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710199

name: Xi'an No.8 Nursery School Underground Parking
address: 8XV3+W9H正北方向50米, 356, Weiyang, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710018

detail_description: 江西一绝养身汤吧（NO.7） is a hidden gem that offers a unique and rejuvenating experience. The establishment provides a variety of healthful soups that are not only delicious but also beneficial for the body. With its cozy ambiance and friendly staff, it's an ideal place to unwind and nourish your body with their specially crafted soups.
name: 江西一绝养身汤吧（NO.7）
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 白花村76号

detail_description: Discover the art of crafting your own miniature Terracotta Warrior at 紫裳薇儿服饰（NO.6）, guided by a local potter. This hands-on experience provides insight into the ancient techniques and cultural significance behind these iconic figures found in Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum.
name: 紫裳薇儿服饰（NO.6）
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 常青二路银池·花香丽舍商铺006号

detail_description: 锦衣柜（NO.10） is a vibrant pedestrian street in Grand Tang Dynasty Evern Bright City, showcasing the grandeur of the prosperous Tang culture. Spanning 2100 meters north to south and 500 meters east to west, it features impressive Tang-style architecture.
name: 锦衣柜（NO.10）
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 十里铺东村139号

name: 爱得宝便利NO.14
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 张家堡商圈, 邮政编码: 710018

detail_description: Just a stone's throw away from Xian Airport, 悦达·起亚西安向辉汽车服务中心（NO.12） is the Hanyangling Museum, which houses the Tomb of Emperor Jingdi of Han Dynasty. This ancient mausoleum, dating back 2,000 years, boasts a tranquil ambiance and remarkably lifelike pottery figurines.
name: 悦达·起亚西安向辉汽车服务中心（NO.12）
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 渭滨街徐家湾工业区18号

detail_description: "鑫源五金日杂百货（NO.2）" is a must-visit destination in Xian, offering a mix of historical, cultural, and religious experiences. It's located just a 2-hour drive from Mount Huashan, making it an ideal addition to your itinerary for a 1-2 day visit. The site features ancient buildings and provides an opportunity for sightseeing amidst the mountainous landscape.
name: 鑫源五金日杂百货（NO.2）
address: China, Shaanxi, Xi'An, Weiyang, 庞马村

detail_description: Fengcheng No.9 Bicycle Zulindian invites you to embark on a journey through time at the enchanting Tang Dynasty Furong Garden, also known as Tang Paradise. This captivating theme park immerses visitors in the rich heritage of the Tang Dynasty, which flourished over 1300 years ago. As you wander through its beautifully designed traditional gardens, you'll be surrounded by serene landscapes that echo ancient Chinese aesthetics.
name: Fengcheng No.9 Bicycle Zulindian
address: 8XX2+323, Fengchengjiu Rd, 张家堡商圈 Weiyang, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710018

detail_description: Shuyuanmen, also known as the Ancient Cultural Street of Shuyuanmen and Antique Market, is a must-visit destination in Xi'an for those looking to purchase traditional Chinese souvenirs. Here, visitors can find a wide array of items such as Tang tri-colored glazed pottery, replicas of Terracotta warriors, paper-cut art, calligraphy tools, shadow puppets, antiques, handmade crafts, jewelry and more.
name: Shuyuanmen
address: 7W3X+6M2, Shuyuanmen St, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710008

excerpt: Modern museum complex featuring local heritage displays, gardens with pools & a historic pagoda.
detail_description: Xi'an Museum is a modern complex that showcases local heritage and features beautiful gardens with pools and a historic pagoda. Since its establishment in 2009, the museum has hosted various remarkable exhibitions, including Chinese art creations, realistic painting school oil paintings, Chinese painting and calligraphy masters' fine art, and photography retrospectives. The museum also houses an impressive collection of classic paintings, calligraphy works, children's paintings, photography, sculpture works, and media art.
name: Xi'an Museum
address: 72 Youyi W Rd, Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Buddhist temple known for its elaborate architectural details, relic museum & cherry trees.
detail_description: Qinglong Temple is a renowned Buddhist temple with intricate architectural designs and a museum housing relics. It has been historically significant as a training ground for Buddhist monks, attracting Japanese monks seeking to learn about Buddhism. Notably, the temple's history is intertwined with the teachings brought back to Japan by the monk Kukai in 806. Situated amidst picturesque surroundings, including cherry trees that bloom beautifully from mid-March to April, it is considered a hidden gem for tourists visiting Xian.
name: Qinglong Temple
address: Yan Ta Qu, Xi An Shi, China, 710054

excerpt: Buddhist temple complex dating to the 3rd century, considered the birthplace of Tantric Buddhism.
detail_description: Daxingshan Temple is a Buddhist temple complex with a history dating back to the 3rd century, known as the birthplace of Tantric Buddhism. It is located in Xi'an and offers a serene and beautiful experience away from the tourist crowds. The ancient temples and paintings within the complex are exquisite, providing visitors with an opportunity for peaceful exploration. Additionally, there is a vegetarian restaurant on-site that offers a wide variety of delicious food options.
name: Daxingshan Temple
address: 55 Xingshansi W St, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710064

excerpt: Shaanxi is a northwestern Chinese province whose ancient capital, Xi’an, was a starting point for the Silk Road. Xi’an is home to the Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor, an archaeological site containing thousands of clay soldiers called the Terracotta Army. In the city center is the 7-story Giant Wild Goose Pagoda and Shaanxi History Museum, displaying feudal dynasties’ relics.
detail_description: Shaanxi, a province in northwestern China, is home to the ancient capital city of Xi'an, which served as a significant starting point for the Silk Road. The city boasts attractions such as the Mausoleum of the First Qin Emperor with its Terracotta Army, the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda, and Shaanxi History Museum showcasing relics from feudal dynasties. With a rich history dating back to the seventh and eighth centuries A.D.
name: Shaanxi
address: China

detail_description: Silkroad, once the starting point of the historical Silk Road, is a city that has been influenced by various cultures and religions due to centuries of trade and settlement. It was a bustling metropolis during the Tang Dynasty and continues to showcase its rich history through ancient monuments, temples, and archaeological treasures. The city's diverse heritage is evident in the presence of pagodas, Buddhist and Taoist temples, as well as mosques that have been established over time.
name: Silkroad
address: 53 Jiefang Rd, 钟楼商圈 Xincheng, Xi'An, Shaanxi Province, China, 710005

detail_description: Shanxi Grand Opera House in Xi'an offers a captivating Tang Dynasty Music and Dance Show, providing a mesmerizing glimpse into Chinese history and culture. The performance features an enchanting blend of lights, music, vibrant costumes, and traditional musical instruments like the paixiao. Guests can also indulge in a special dumpling dinner with an assortment of hot dumplings served throughout the show.
name: Shanxi Grand Opera House
address: 161 Wenyi N Rd, 雁塔ＩＴ商圈 Beilin, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710001

excerpt: Vast archaeological park with ruins & reconstructed elements of a Tang Dynasty imperial palace.
detail_description: Daming Palace National Heritage Park is a vast archaeological site featuring the remains and reconstructed features of an imperial palace from the Tang Dynasty. Visitors can freely explore the park, square, and ancient palace gate dating back to 634 AD. The area offers open green spaces, a model of the palace, and occasional public performances at the IMAX theater.
name: Daming Palace National Heritage Park
address: 585 Ziqiang E Rd, Xincheng, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710015

detail_description: Guanzhong Folk-custom Art Museum offers a glimpse into the social and cultural life of people in Shaanxi from the 3rd century AD to the early 20th century. The museum houses a vast collection of stone carvings, ancient residences, and intangible cultural heritage items such as local operas, traditional rites and customs, and workshops for traditional handicrafts. The owner has meticulously collected and rebuilt various architectural elements from old buildings.
name: Guanzhong Folk-custom Art Museum
address: 2XHC+2WW, Chang'An, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710107

detail_description: Shaanxi Xi'an Botanical Garden is a convenient and beautiful destination, especially for travelers. The garden offers free entertainment and shows every night, creating a wonderful atmosphere. Visitors can also enjoy the serene surroundings and indulge in delicious coffee at the on-site bookshop. The authentic architecture adds to the beauty of this place, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring the area.
name: Shaanxi Xi'an Botanical Garden
address: 17 Cuihua Rd, Yanta District, Xi'An, Shaanxi, China, 710063
